OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Removed outer pink layer in the inset; changed Fat label to say "Fat around the bladder"; added back in the paravesical fat and put line from the label “Fat around the bladder” so that it points to that fat in addition to the fat layer in the inset; made cancer spot darker to distinguish it from the fat.
Made the cancer spot in the little box and on the inset wider so that it almost spans the entire box without going any deeper into the layers.

Removed perivesical fat around bladder; removed Peritoneum label; removed all lines from labels to little box on the main figure; added a line going from the top right and bottom right corners of little box on main figure to the top and bottom left corners on the inset.
Changed labels from Serosa to Fat, Lamina propria to Connective tissue, and Urothelium to Inner lining. Added color to show the different layers in the inset.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage I bladder cancer; drawing shows the bladder, ureter, prostate, and urethra. Inset shows cancer in the inner lining of the bladder and in the layer of connective tissue next to it. Also shown are the muscle layers of the bladder and the layer of fat around the bladder.

Stage I bladder cancer; drawing shows the bladder, ureter, prostate, and urethra. Inset shows cancer in the inner lining of the bladder and in the layer of connective tissue next to it. Also shown are the muscle layers of the bladder and the layer of fat around the bladder.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage I bladder cancer. Cancer has spread to the layer of connective tissue next to the inner lining of the bladder.
Stage I bladder cancer. Cancer has spread to the layer of connective tissue next to the inner lining of the bladder.
